issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Using  eulb-apply-security-groups-to-lb the group is not added to the load balancer. I have tried using the group name as well as the group id.


{code}
root@c-30 ~]# eulb-apply-security-groups-to-lb -g  sg-A06740DF LoadStar --debug
2013-05-16 13:47:14,178 DEBUG   ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer parsed arguments: {'SecurityGroups.member': ['sg-A06740DF'], 'url': None, 'userregion': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'LoadBalancerName': 'LoadStar', 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None}
2013-05-16 13:47:14,180 INFO    ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer parameters: {'Action': 'ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer', 'SecurityGroups.member.1': 'sg-A06740DF', 'Version': '2012-06-01', 'LoadBalancerName': 'LoadStar'}
2013-05-16 13:47:14,181 INFO    ELB sending request (attempt 1 of 3)

2013-05-16 13:47:14,188 DEBUG   ELB request data:   AWSAccessKeyId: AWF1FEZKGRCYXOQ76HMH5

fields.summary: Cannot add security group to load balancer

comments.body: This is for VPC only which is not yet supported in Eucalyptus
